name: Southwestern Corn and Black Bean Skillet
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: A simple Southwest corn and black bean skillet that goes well with tacos, enchiladas, fish, and even burgers.
ingredients: 4 ears corn, shucked and kernels removed
1 large jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced
1 pinch salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
directions: Combine corn, bell pepper, jalapeno, onion, lime juice, chili powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add corn mixture and cook until onion has softened, about 6 minutes
Stir in black beans and cook for 2 minutes more
Remove from heat and sprinkle cilantro over the top
